body:
Features and Enhancements

Components
  • New Features and Enhancements
    • Homepage Redesign
      • The team has been working behind the scenes the past few months to deliver one of the most evolutionary changes to the Network360 interface. As of 06/09/2021, the new Network360 homepage is here and features an all new look and feel to navigate through Network360!
    • Benefits:
      • Easier navigation between reports.
      • Simplified process to find reports that meet your needs.
      • Summary information immediately available to help get you started.
      • Interactive charts to help guide you to locate specific details for your inquiries.
  • Homepage Report Data:
    • Please be advised that homepage reporting data is being imported as quickly as possible.
    • (1) client projects need to be refreshed to fully enable the new homepage reports
    • (2) Dental Clients who do not contribute claims will not see all the new report functionality
    • (3) Clients who don't have 'My Networks' or 'Competitor Networks' will see slightly different functionality
    • (4) The rest of the reports in Network360 are UNCHANGED. Users can work like normal within the system.
  • Enhancements:
    • What's it look like?
      • First, there's a bit of flexibility engineered inside the homepage layout.
      • The Interactive US Map can appear to the right side of the screen for users that prefer to keep a wider browser window.
      • Should you choose to keep a more traditional vertical browser window, the homepage will automatically move the interactive US Map below the charts on screen.
    • Menu Navigation:
      • Tiles have been replaced by the menu on the left side accessible at any time from any report.
      • The menu is grouped into two areas of focus:
        • Work based - All menus
        • Settings - Personal, System and Support
      • There are 13 menu navigation options for a ZNA admin to see and access.
        • To simplify the interface, Network360 will only show menu options that are based on which products/services you and your client team subscribe too.
        • The same roles, permissions and access remain unchanged.
      • Several of the icons contain a sub-menu to access similarly grouped areas of functionality within Network360.
        • Icons with a small triangle appearing to the bottom right has a sub-menu.
        • Tool tips will appear to help users navigate the sub-menus
    • Chart Widgets:
      • Each chart widget provides a powerful amount of capabilities at your fingertips.
      • When you move your mouse over a chart item, a pop-up window will appear and display details about the data within the chart.
      • To drill down a step deeper into the data. Click the respective chart widget and Network360 can pull up the corresponding report screen and display the results.
        • New Concepts introduced to the Network360 homepage lexicon:
          • Available Networks - market coverage of networks included in your project, relative to what Zelis has available in that market
          • Confirmed (Core) Providers - Confirmed Providers by address (Medical, Vision, Behavioral) or claims data (Dental) within a chosen geography
          • New (Core) Providers - rolling 90 day update of matching NPI and ZNA provider data
          • Top Networks - Highest count of unique core providers by geography within clients data subscription
    • Interactive US Map:
      • The US Map is multi-functional, it can be used to:
        • Review the applicable summary details for each state
        • Filter data to view at the state level
        • Review Counties within a chosen State
    • Exports:
      • Users can export data into a PDF report based on what's selected on the US Map.
    • Activity Stream:
      • The Activity Stream has been relocated near the top right corner of the homepage.
      • When you Click on the TimeClock icon, Network360 will display the Activities in a pop-up window.
      • Click the TimeClock icon again to close the Activity Stream pop-up window.
      • Users can still review the Stream, Search and Click on an item and Network360 will redirect the user to the chosen screen.
